info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 2:58PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern McDowell and southeastern Yancey Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 258 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of Marion, or near B.R. Parkway-Little Switzerland To Linville, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marion, Old Fort, B.R. Parkway-Craggy To Little Switzerland, Lake James, Sugar Hill, Busick, Pleasant Gardens, Woodlawn and Glenwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
